reviewText: From his early days as 'Nobody' Terence Hill cast a long shadow in the genre of Spaghetti Westerns. In this latest configuration, Hill mutates to a more mellowed, mature western figure of masculinity; but, just behind those blue eyes there is a sparkle of the whimsical youth measured against the wisdom of years. All bets are on Doc West as he plays out his hand adhering to the same standards he established for himself when he played opposite the monumental talents of Henry Fonda. If you like westerns with as much 'grey matter' as sound effects, blood and guts, you'll be entertained by Doc West... or Triggerman, they obviously released the film under two titles.
summary: Doc West or Triggerman is good viewing
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: This is the 2nd installment of the DOC WEST series.  Don't miss the 1st movie calledDoc West (Widescreen)!GREAT family movie!If you're looking for a funny movie that you can watch without being embarrassed to have your children watch too, then this is a GREAT choice!
summary: The Further Adventures of DOC WEST
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: Sorvino and Hill are very compatible actors and all of the supporting cast are a good fit in a well written script with heart!  Yeah, it's an old time story with lotsa heart, guts and schmaltz, but it works!
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: This isn't anything like other Terence Hill movies; it is slow and boring and his character is bland and uninteresting. It was a let down.
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: Terrence Hill was terrific in the Trinity series and since then was in decline in every movie.  Disappointment, never again
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: Not much action or plot. Story line is not very exciting and does not hold your interest. .Not up to caliber for a Western.
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: It makes more sense if you see Doc West first cause this is a sequel.If you love the style of Trinity,you probably won't like this film.The directing is good,acting's good,musics great.Great film for the entire family.
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: I watched it after several years and every charm I once sensed still prevails.  Kudos to the staff and actors who define such impacts!
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: This is a great sequel to Doc West, and has some very humorous scenes in it. It does seem interesting that Paul Sorvino who was in the Doc West movie, looks like he has taken up the role of Buddy Spencer, who had worked very well together with Terance Hill.
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: I would have given it a 5 star rating except I really dislike today's westerns. This movie was better than most I have recently watched. I like Terence Hill movies. B westerns are my favorite! Oldies are great!
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: Ponderously slow, and too low-key for its own good, "Triggerman" is a not as much fun as it could have been. The acting is uneven and the story too predictable. But flawed as it is, it has enough odd charm that it is hard to dislike.
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: A drifter (Hill) comes back to the town of Holy Sand and wants to help the locals by building a hospital, but needs money.  In the sequel to Doc West (not necessary but helpful to watch first), Doc West (Hill) is still in high demand as a doctor.  After half the town gets hurt in a bar fight he realizes its time to open up a hospital.  He turns to the only way he knows in order to make money, a poker tournament.  When an evil Dutchman rides in to town, (to compete and stop West from getting the money he needs) West must decide what is more important, the money or love.  If you liked the first one you will probebly like this one as well.  For me, low budget TV movies with bad acting are not my thing. I give it a D+.
summary: Sequel to DOC WEST - A doctor wants to help town by building a hospital through poker winnings. Overall kinda lame...I say D+
Title: Triggerman

reviewText: Terence Hill continues the adventures of 'DOC WEST' in this direct sequel to the original.  The same characters return with the same actors with a surprise appearance by Euro actress Ornella Muti making it seem Hill may be creating a potential series.  It seems our hero is still in the town of Holy Sands and is running out of money to send to his daughter so West's inamorata who is the teacher in town suggests building a hospital.  Naturally, it takes money so it doesn't take long for West and the Sheriff played excellently by Paul Sorvino to set up a major poker tournament so that West, the best poker player in the area, can clean up and win. Naturally, their are bad guys around to put a wrench in the proceedings which makes this outing a bit grittier than the first film.  However, the sentimentality is still there and the credits including the continuation of Maurizio De Angelis's great music score are up to the standards of the original.  If you liked the first one (like I did), you'll love this one.  It's worth it just to see the great Terence Hill looking comedic and lethal in the same shot and bringing honor and loyalty back to the Western genre. Doc, you rule!!
Title: Triggerman
